Description.val:
FY12 funding total includes $.110M appropriated for Overseas Contingency Operations. 
FY13 funding total includes $2.557M requested for Overseas Contingency Operations.

This vehicle group consist of various vehicles for flightline, maintenance, and facility operations used for a variety of purposes.  Examples of these vehicles include the IW 40 tractor, six- and ten- passenger over-the-snow-carriers, an assortment of wreckers and refuse trucks, and water distribution trucks.  The IW 40 tractor is a small farm tractor used primarily to pull a mower and for other light tasks; the snow carriers are tracked vehicles which move personnel in snowy conditions and are used in search and rescue missions; the wreckers are used to move disabled vehicles, haul vehicles or to deploy a heavy duty winch.  The refuse trucks in this group include one which tilts and dumps a payload and one which compacts refuse prior to discharge.  Water distribution trucks are used primarily to wet down and control dust at a construction site.  

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

Program elements associated with this P-1 line are: 0202834F, 0207224F, 0207597F, 0207588F, 0402834F, 0502834F, 0502844F, 0702831F, 0802834F.

Justification.val:
FY14 procurement dollars in the amount of $13.983M procures 94 vehicles in support of installation and unit mission requirements for Air Force personnel.

Items requested in FY14 are identified on the following P-40A, and are representative of items to be procured.  Items procured during execution may change based on critical equipment needed to support current Air Force Mission Requirements.

Name.@footnote: 1EA to be procured with FY13 OCO
3EA to be procured with FY13 OCO
1EA to be procured with FY12 OCO
2EA to be procured with FY13 OCO

Remarks.val:
FY14 unit prices are subject to change.

FY14 PMA Justification:
Large Capacity Refueling Vehicle (LCRV), Buy, Preliminary Design Review (PDR). This will be the first Air Force procurement of an LCRV and a thorough PDR is vital to ensure proper design of vehicle before production.  Additionally, we must ensure all specific military operational requirements will be met.

Large Capacity Refueling Vehicle, Buy, First Production Test. Perform inspection and operational test of first production unit of new LCRV to ensure operational, safety, and sustainment requirements are met before full rate production ensues.

R-11 Refueling Truck, Buy, Critical Design Review (CDR). CDR is vital to ensure proper design of vehicle before production.  Additionally, we must ensure all specific military operational requirements will be met.

R-11 Refueling Truck, Buy, First Production Test. Perform inspection and operational test of first production unit of initially produced R-11 to ensure operational, safety, and sustainment requirements are met before full rate production ensues.  

R-11 Refueling Truck, Buy, User Operational Test. Perform thorough, comprehensive, and extensive operational user testing of newly designed R-11 in military air base setting at Seymour Johnson AFB, NC. 

R-12 Refueling Truck, Buy, Preliminary Design Review (PDR). The R-12 facilitates transfer of hundreds of gallons of fuel per minute between aircraft and in-ground tanks, above-ground tanks, and other refueling vehicles.

R-12 Refueling Truck, Buy, First Production Test. Perform inspection and operational test of first production unit of new R-12 to ensure operational, safety, and sustainment requirements are met before full rate production ensues.
